description: Qualitative analysis charts, compute-metrics edge function UI, and thematic coding infrastructure

changes.description: Researchers can now view live sentiment arc and engagement charts on the Qualitative Analysis page, showing formal vs informal comparisons for mean sentiment, sentiment arc (early/mid/late), words per turn, turn counts, and speaking time ratio. Implemented by fetching call_qualitative_metrics in QualitativeAnalysis.tsx and replacing placeholder cards with Recharts bar charts grouped by condition.

Researchers can trigger qualitative metrics computation directly from the Researcher Dashboard via a new 'Compute metrics' button in the Responses â†’ Advanced section, with a 45-second timeout, batch progress toasts, and a 'Hard recompute all' option. Implemented by adding handleComputeMetrics with Promise.race timeout to UnifiedParticipantsTable, fetching pending counts on load, and surfacing errors in the toast.
changes.details: The edge function is invoked via supabase.functions.invoke in batches of 25; a Promise.race timeout fires a clear error toast if the function is not deployed.

changes.description: Researcher tooling now includes a Node.js script and two Supabase edge functions for computing qualitative metrics and running LLM-based thematic coding from AssemblyAI utterances. Added scripts/compute-qualitative-metrics.mjs, scripts/run-llm-thematic-coding.mjs, and supabase/functions/compute-qualitative-metrics + run-thematic-coding edge functions.
